Description: Pottery Tell El-Yahudiyeh ware juglet; wheel-made; cylindrical neck flaring slightly to rolled rim; vertical handle from below rim to shoulder; biconical body; button base; horizontally combed decoration around body; traces of highly lustrous burnishing on the uncombed areas around the maximum diameter, neck and handle; surface worn in places.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Turner Bequest Excavations, Enkomi
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (C194)
Kaplan 1980 / The Origin and Distribution of Tell el Yahudiyeh Ware. (P. 320, Fig. 119.b)
